intro: Phlebocarya pilosissima subsp. pilosissima, commonly known as the hairy phlebocarya, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to wet conditions and its role in supporting local insect populations.
